snippet: It was Secretary of State John Kerry’s most pointed criticism so far of Russia’s supply of weaponry to the Syrian government.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry strongly criticizes Russia's pledge to sell advanced antiaircraft weapons to Syria, suggesting that along with the growing involvement of Iran and Hezbollah in the fighting, sale threatens to disrupt efforts to negotiate a political settlement and may destabilize the region; Kerry's remarks signal growing frustration with Russia's continuing support for Pres Bashar al-Assad's government.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon; Neil MacFarquhar from the United Nations; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: It was Secretary of State John Kerry’s most pointed criticism so far of Russia’s supply of weaponry to the Syrian government.

headline.seo: Kerry Castigates Russia Over Syria-Bound Missiles
headline.main: Kerry Castigates Russia Over Syria-Bound Missiles
headline.print_headline: Kerry Rebukes Russia for Its Sale of Antiaircraft Missiles to Syria

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
